page.title: 09THE EVERGREEN CLUB OF SELSEY
page.content: The{Evergreen Club}is a social club which also provides outings and holidays. It was started 15-20 years ago,and it was named the Evergreen Club because they felt that it's very young at heart.There are about{600 {members},more women than men and it's run by a committee.Although there's no age limit it's mostly for the over 60s.It costs Â£1.00 a year to belong. The club depends on the{Venture Club for transport and they give them a donation every year.They hire the parish hall some afternoons for bingo and whist-drives where they have tea and biscuits and a raffle.On Friday afternoons they meet at Manhood Community College Youthwing where they can play snooker,darts,table tennis and other games.They have about 20 coach outings and 2 holidays a year which the members pay for.
